notes.text:
An update is now available for CloudForms Management Engine 5.8.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat CloudForms Management Engine delivers the insight, control, and automation needed to address the challenges of managing virtual environments. CloudForms Management Engine is built on Ruby on Rails, a model-view-controller (MVC) framework for web application development.

Security Fix(es):

* python-paramiko: Authentication bypass in transport.py (CVE-2018-7750)

* ansible-tower: Privilege escalation flaw allows for organization admins to obtain system privileges (CVE-2018-1101)

* ansible-tower: Remote code execution by users with access to define variables in job templates (CVE-2018-1104)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Red Hat would like to thank Simon Vikström for reporting CVE-2018-1104. The CVE-2018-1101 issue was discovered by Graham Mainwaring (Red Hat).
notes.title: Details

acknowledgments.summary: This issue was discovered by Red Hat.

notes.text: Ansible Tower, before version 3.2.4, has a flaw in the management of system and organization administrators that allows for privilege escalation. System administrators that are members of organizations can have their passwords reset by organization administrators, allowing organization administrators access to the entire system.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: ansible-tower: Privilege escalation flaw allows for organization admins to obtain system privileges
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

notes.text: Ansible Tower through version 3.2.3 has a vulnerability that allows users only with access to define variables for a job template to execute arbitrary code on the Tower server.

vulnerabilities.title: ansible-tower: Remote code execution by users with access to define variables in job templates

notes.text: It was found that when acting as an SSH server, paramiko did not properly check whether authentication is completed before processing other requests. A customized SSH client could use this to bypass authentication when accessing any resources controlled by paramiko.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text:
This flaw is a user authentication bypass in the SSH Server functionality of paramiko (normally used by subclassing `paramiko.ServerInterface`). Where paramiko is used only for its client-side functionality (e.g. `paramiko.SSHClient`), the vulnerability is not exposed and thus cannot be exploited.

The following Red Hat products use paramiko only in client-side mode. Server side functionality is not used.

* Red Hat Ceph Storage 2
* Red Hat CloudForms 4
* Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
* Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization
* Red Hat Gluster Storage 3
* Red Hat Openshift Container Platform
* Red Hat Quick Cloud Installer
* Red Hat Satellite 6
* Red Hat Storage Console 2
* Red Hat OpenStack Platform
* Red Hat Update Infrastructure
notes.title: Statement
